item.title: Using Putty and Emacs' Tramp on Windows
item.description: Introduction and Motivation Windows doesn't support a lot of common Unix commands, ssh included. There are several ways to overcome this fact. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is one option. I've used it and it's certainly a big step up over native windows shells. But to get any GUI applications you have to set up an X server or somesuch (to my knowledge -- which is admittedly limited at present). It's also a bit of a pain to interface natively with normal Windows files, since you have to use /mnt/c/ to get to to them.

item.title: Having a Website and Complications Therein
item.description: A question I have gotten from several people in the few months I've had my site up is "what's the point?" It's a good question. Bad Reasons To Have a Website First, some reasons I think are lame. A lot of people recommend you have a website to showcase your CV/Resume, your projects, and "what skills and experience you bring to the table." (You know the type of arguments, and the nauseating language employed therein).

item.title: Starting Up a Blog
item.description: Blogging can serve a useful purpose, even if it is not perfect I've toyed with the idea of blogging for a while now.
